alert.note: Alert for Union (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 29 at 11:30AM EST until February 06 at 2:00PM EST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Kentucky...Indiana...Illinois... Ohio River at Newburgh Dam, Mount Vernon, J.T. Myers Dam and Shawneetown. .Above normal rainfall this month continues to cause significant rises on the Ohio River. The river will rise above flood stage at Newburgh and Shawneetown tonight, and at Mount Vernon and J.T. Myers Wednesday morning. The river will crest at these points Friday night into Saturday morning. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TUESDAY NIGHT TO TUESDAY, FEBRUARY 06... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ohio River at J.T. Myers Dam. * WHEN...From late Tuesday night to Tuesday, February 06. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CST Monday the stage was 33.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 37.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Wednesday morning to a crest of 38.6 feet Friday evening. It will then fall below flood stage Tuesday, February 06. - Flood stage is 37.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/pah.
